concept.title: Removing a Lockout Tagout Device

audience.otherprops: maintenance personnel, supervisors, safety and compliance officers, machine operators, reliability engineers

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Controls and steps required to remove locks and tags including verification communication and authorised removal procedures.

othermeta.name: taxonomy
othermeta.content: domain:ehs/usecase:remove-lockout-and-restore-energy/industry:glass manufacturing heavy machinery and industrial equipment

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: remove lock, authorised removal, post removal checks

ol.li: Before lockout devices are removed and energy is restored to the machine or equipment, the authorized employee will verify the equipment is fully reassembled, emergency stops reactivated, and guards replaced.
Lockout and Tagout devices shall be removed by the authorized employee who installed them.

Whenever an authorized employee who applied a Lockout Tagout device is not available to remove such device, it may only be removed by a supervisor or designee, only after it has been verified that the authorized employee who attached the Lockout Tagout device is no longer at the facility, using Form EHS-02-107-F 005 Abandoned Lock Removal Form or equivalent.
The supervisor or designee must inspect the equipment thoroughly to ensure it can be operated safely before removing the Lockout Tagout device.

The authorized employee who installed the original Lockout Tagout device shall be contacted and informed that the Lockout Tagout device has been removed during his/her absence before resuming their next work shift.
